comment._content: Could it be Dysertmore? Also see here.

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: Dysertmore, Kilkenny maps.osi.ie/publicviewer/#V1,666507,633714,7,9 On earlier 6-inch maps it was called Newgrove House maps.osi.ie/publicviewer/#V1,666507,633714,7,8 1911 census, Newgrove, Brownsford, Kilkenny Mary Lambert, widow, age 68. She had a son and a female companion. www.census.nationalarchives.ie/pages/1911/Kilkenny/Browns...

comment._content: woow.. the quality of the photo is amazing.. it looks way better than the photos taken with little modern 12mp cameras..

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland] 
Her face looks younger than 66, but she is wearing expensive widow's black and has a "full" figure under that corseting. I think "Miss Lambert" is the Merry Widow.

comment.author: 99684904@N00
comment._content: Another observer wondered if the same prop was used in this photo and the Maloney family photo one. So I did a little meshup; I also noticed that there has been some photo editing. Part of her left shoulder was removed.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/blackpoolbeach] We'll have to agree to differ on this one.  :)
I really examined her face at a huge size, and it just doesn't look (to me) like the face of someone coming up on 70...

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: thepeerage.com/p852.htm#i8520 Ambrose Lambert was born in 1827. He was the son of Ambrose Lambert and Eliza Snow. He married Mary Coppinger, daughter of Francis Coppinger, in 1864. He died on 11 August 1878. He held the office of Justice of the Peace (J.P.). He lived at New Grove, County Kilkenny, Ireland. Children of Ambrose Lambert and Mary Coppinger Mabel Lambert Ethel Lambert Ambrose Lambert b. 1865 Nicholas Henry Lambert b. 1867, d. 1 Aug 1943 Henry Lambert b. 1868, d. 1893 Francis Lambert b. 1874, d. 1896 Bertrand Lambert b. 1878 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Ethel Lambert married in 1896. No mention of Mabel Lambert marriage, so the photo could be of her. More questions than answers....

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: There is another portrait of Miss Lambert holding a copy of "Home...", so it must be "Home Circle". catalogue.nli.ie/Record/P_WP_1882/Image?lookfor=http://ww... In the 1911 census Mary Florence Wallace is shown as "Companion and Farmers". A closer look shows it could be "Companion and governess".

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/blackpoolbeach] Much happier with Mabel!! Thank you so much for all of your research. From your great map work, we know that Dysertmore was formerly New Grove, where the Ambrose Lambert/ Mary Coppinger family lived... P.S. It looks as if Ambrose and Mary got married at the Chapel of the British Embassy in Paris!
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
